summary: The `npm init @temporalio` command may fail when users run it a second time after a new version of `@temporalio/create` is released, because npm doesn't update the cached package which may contain an incompatible project template.
userImpact: Users attempting to initialize new projects using the recommended command may encounter failures if they've previously used it with an older version of the create package.
rootCause: npm init does not update cached packages, so @temporalio/create remains at the old version which may have incompatible project templates for newer temporalio versions.
proposedFix: Hardcode the temporalio version in the published @temporalio/create package, or recommend using `npx @temporalio/create@latest` which forces package updates.
workaround: Use `npx @temporalio/create@latest` instead of `npm init @temporalio` to ensure the latest version is used.
resolutionDetails: The team stopped recommending `npm init @temporalio` in favor of the `npx @temporalio/create@latest` approach due to this npm limitation.
keyQuote: We stopped recommending `npm init @temporalio` for the package initializer due to this limitation.
